definition: to teach face to face/to instruct in person
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to give direct instructions on the way to deal with a matter/to brief personally (idiom)

sentences.english: Fourthly, the adequate face-to-face teaching is useful to supplement modern distance education.
sentences.chinese: 第四，适当的面授教学是现代远程教育的有益补充。

sentences.english: Joe Aguirre, wavy hair the color of cigarette ash and parted down the middle, gave them his point of view.
sentences.chinese: 乔留着一头中分的烟灰色波浪发，在给他俩面授机宜。

sentences.english: This is a part-time face-to-face programme.
Do you find the tutorial helpful?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得面授辅导课有帮助吗？

definition: school begins/give a course/teach a subject
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
courseware (abbr. for 課程軟件|课程软件[ke4 cheng2 ruan3 jian4])
to transfer (from production to other duties)/to take leave (for study or other job)/to dispose of property/to transfer assets (to avoid liability)
